medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and signs of sexual precocity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms of sexual precocity occurred at the age of 24 months. The patient was taken to a pediatrician at the age of 31 months due to abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosis of hypertensive congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH), previously treated with prednisolone and hydrocortisone.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's mother and sister are carriers of the chimeric gene.
